fields.description:

With JSDCLOUD-59  feature implementation, we now see a new format of the SLA [A fresh look at SLAs in Jira Service Management|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management-articles/A-fresh-look-at-SLAs-in-Jira-Service-Management/ba-p/1881636#M1072]

Increase the width of these columns in the Queue View.

Currently, is not possible to pin any of the fields created for the *Incident Management* feature.
h3. Suggested Solution

 !Screenshot_161719.png|thumbnail!

fields.description: We have built requests that require (1) approval from each of the (3) different approval groups.  We have created a queue for each approval group to show what requests still need to be approved.  However, once one group approves the request, it doesn't fall off their list until the other two approver groups have approved.  Can someone provide insight on how to query these requests so that they fall off the list for that specific approval group once they have approved?
fields.summary: Approval Queues - Requests Not Removing From Queue Until All Approver Groups Have Approved

fields.description:
For example: Have a client who's source system creates a file that we import. The source system does not fill out a certain field when it is not needed - think of it as a flag.

When this imports into Insight, Insight doesn't show the attribute's existence when it is empty. This mimics Jira's native functionality of hiding empty issue fields.

This has caused confusion with multiple clients. In Jira, hiding empty fields is seen as a feature to prevent bloat and unnecessary scrolling; however, when it comes to Insight, the clients overwhelmingly see this as an omission of critical data.

I would like a way to:
* on the attribute, set a flag to force it to always show the attribute.

I'm sure this flag could be extended all the way up the chain (e.g. enable for entire schema), but I leave that up to you.

For numerical attributes, setting a default usually suffices; however, for many text fields, setting a default value would be redundant at best and confusing at worst.
fields.summary: Ability to toggle showing empty Insight attributes.

fields.description:
Customers would like the ability to employ SPF flattening while implementing DMARC.

This is to be able to circumvent the 10 max limit of DNS lookup.

This limitation restricts the number of DNS lookups that can be performed when an SPF record is evaluated.

SPF records usually contain 'include' statements that refer to other domains' SPF records to list servers that are allowed to send on behalf of the organization's domain. Any parts of the SPF record that are listed after the 10th lookup has been reached will not be evaluated. This means that although you have listed something in your SPF record, it may not be evaluated, causing legitimate services to fail authentication via SPF
fields.summary: Allow SPF Flattening when configuring a DNS Server using DMARC

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the project default language is set to another language (ie. Spanish) and English is set as a second language, the customer notifications email template remains in English if '{_}Automatically detect browser setting{_}' is selected in the customer profile.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the [project's default language|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/change-your-service-projects-default-language/] to Spanish
 # Add English (United States) as a second language
 # Select the 'Automatically detect browser setting' option in the Language field when editing the customer account
 # Open a ticket in the service project to receive the notifications (make sure the notifications are enabled in the service project)

h3. Expected Results

The customer notifications should be sent using the project's default language.
h3. Actual Results

The content of the notification is sent using the project's default language, but the email template is sent in English.

!Notification.png|width=345,height=179!
h3. Workaround

The customer needs to change the language associated with their account by following the steps below:
1. Open the Help center > Select the avatar in the top right > Select Profile
2. In the Language field, select the correct language > Save
fields.summary: The email template remains in English if 'Automatically detect browser setting' is selected in the customer profile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom fields of select type it is not using the preset value from the request form. Instead using the default value from custom field configuration when issues are created via customer portal. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of select list type
 # Add few options like
 -- Options 1
 -- Options 2
 -- Options 3
 # Set the default value as "Options 1" in custom field configuration.
!image-2021-12-23-14-40-33-343.png|width=187,height=111!
 # Associated the fields to screen
 # Add the custom field created in step#1 to the request form. 
 # Hide the field, it will ask to add preset value. Set value as "Options 2"
!image-2021-12-23-14-57-31-492.png|width=258,height=116!
 # Now created a new issue from portal. 

{*}Note{*}: This is only reproducible on some sites. 
h3. Expected Results

New issue should be created with the preset value from the request form (i.e "Options 2").
h3. Actual Results

New issue is created with the default value of the custom field (i.e "Options 1")
h3. Workaround

Set the Default Value of the fields to the value that you want to use for the preset value. 
This workaround doesn't work if the same field is used in multiple request form with different preset value. 
Currently there are no other known workaround for this behaviour. A new workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Select List type (including cascading field) custom fields it is not using the preset value during issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Since Jira Service Management (JSM) projects by default have an integration with Confluence through the Knowledge Base (KB) feature, project administrators are able to make adjustments to the Confluence settings without being Confluence Space administrator.

Since JSM admins can set these KBs to be open to all users, organizations may wish to restrict this ability to a higher level user, such as site or organization admins to prevent accidental exposure of sensitive data due to misconfiguration issues.

h3. Suggested solution
Currently this is default behavior to allow for a smooth integration between the products to allow for KB integration within JSM. It would be beneficial to have a specific permission that can be configured to grant roles the ability to administer the KB settings. This could be removed for the administrator JSM role to prevent their configuration.

_*Note*: At this time no workaround is available to restrict project administrators from managing KB settings_
fields.summary: Restrict Confluence Knowledge Base configuration within Jira Service Management to Site Admins

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if there are 10 consecutive failures (5 for SLA related rules) in the execution of an automation rule, then the rule will be automatically disabled by Automation For Jira (A4J). Although notifications are sent for the failed executions, the notifications for the disable action itself is not sent. The automatic disable also cannot be turned off by the admin.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admins to:
- receive notification when A4J disables a rule due to the consecutive failures in rules
- have ability to turn off the behavior of A4J automatically disabling rules

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Further configuration of automation rules being disabled automatically by Automation For Jira (A4J)

fields.description:
h3. Problem:

On certain projects where we use ProForma to create issues, the form is in the expanded Viewing state when the Jira issue is opened, while on others it is defaulted to the collapsed view and it requires clicking to expand.
h3. Workaround/Explanation

A simple rule is applied that Jira will show the same form on different issues. So if two issues have a form named 'Form A' and you expand it on one issue, it will be expanded by default on the second issue; however, if the second issue does not have the same form you were looking at on the first issue then all forms will start minimised.
fields.summary: Forms: Display forms by default on an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If Insight get's inundated with requests from automation whilst simultaneously running an import the automation rules can fail to get the information back in time and thus fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an automation rule that is triggered by objects that are created/updated or deleted from a specific schema. Add in some object based components to this rule that will call back to insight. Like lookup objects or create object or edit object.
 # Set up an Import inside of insight into the same schema the rule is triggered on. Make sure to import a sufficient amount of objects. Author tried with 5000.

h3. Expected Results

Insight can handle this load and the rules wont fail despite being run at the same time that the import is running.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
{ [-]
   @tag: kube
   caller: sidecar/sidecar.go:281
   computationgroup_id: 123xyz    customer: shared
   env: prod
   error: context canceled
   host_type: k8s
   hostname: ip-10-16-0-115.ec2.internal
   k: { [+]
   }
   level: error
   message: backend service failed to respond
   region: us-east-1
   request_agent: Automation for Jira AC app/1.0
   request_host: 123xyz.internal.shared-prod.us-east-1.kitt-inf.net
   request_id: 70a59a341d382bfa
   request_method: GET
   request_proto: HTTP/1.1
   request_referer:
   request_remote: 10.36.6.0:46448
   request_url: /rest/insight/1.0/object/6888
   timestamp: 2021-12-16T21:19:12.822Z
   version: 2021-12-10T22:46:10.362214Z-7e4bebc4959db79d46178f5f6dfcdd595d72703a
   workspace_id: 123xyz
} {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Turn off the rule during an import or reduce the import size potentially splitting into multiple files.
fields.summary: Running an import and an automation rule that is triggered by it can cause the rules to fail

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's possible for a 'portal only' customer and an 'Atlassian Account' customer with the same email address to be existing in the same service project. 
 !image-2021-12-17-15-47-00-103.png|thumbnail! 

This becomes an issue when the user creates an issue from the Help center portal while logged on to the 'portal only' customer and later replies to the email. Since both customer accounts have the same email address, when Jira receives the email from the user, Jira assumes it's the 'Atlassian Account' customer and creates a new request via [email request|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/choose-a-request-type-for-email-requests/].

h3. Suggested Solution
When there are accounts with the same email address, have a mechanism to detect them and automatically disable the 'portal only' customer counterpart.

h3. Workaround
Manually delete Jira Service Management portal only customers via https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/delete-a-customers-account/
fields.summary: Prevent 'Portal only' customer and 'Atlassian account' customer with the same email address from co-existing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There is an inconsistent behavior between how a Jira Service Management project's Customer page and project setting People page handle users with an Atlassian account who do not have site access.

When trying to add the user via the Customer page, we are unable to do so and get the following error: _test@example.com is not a valid email address_

This error in itself is not an accurate reflection of the issue as the email address is likely valid, however by removing a user's site access the account is considered suspended.

On the project setting's People page, we can add the user and get a success message, but the user never appears. If the user is subsequently provided site access, they will then be listed under both the People and the Customer page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a standard (Non-SSO or portal-only) user under the site
# Revoke their site access
# Attempt to add the user to a Jira Service Management project on the Customers page or the Peoples page

h3. Expected Results
# Both the Customer and People pages return a unified response when trying to add suspended users
# Improve the error messaging for these cases

h3. Actual Results
As mentioned above, depending on where the user is being added, the behavior differs. In the customer page we get an error that does not accurately reflect the reason the user cannot be added and on the people page the user can be added but is not listed.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior when adding User with no site access to a Jira Service Management project

fields.description:
h1. User Stories

- As an Insight admin, I want to represent all of my Jira users as Insight objects without needing to re-import them manually, because they already exist in another area of the same system and I already have enough manual drudge work in my life.

- As an Insight admin, I want to rely on a single source of truth for my user data that all other user-related systems can integrate into because people make maintaining this information is difficult enough without tooling "helping".
h1. Context
 * In the vast majority of Jira Cloud configurations, people have to be represented in the system in order to interact with it; even Jira Service Management customers have user accounts.
 * Having a "user" object in an Insight schema is a very common and basic use-case, and most of the really cool things you can do in Insight requires this.
 * The source of truth for most user data in most organizations is not Atlassian.

 

All of this creates a situation where my Jira users are integrated nicely (usually) with my ID management or SSO provider, but I need to MANUALLY link these to Insight and maintain Insight data.
fields.summary: Better Insight-JIRA User Integration

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Some customers that are part of the organisation are not found when searched for from the top level page (customers parent page).
h3. Environment

JSM Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Customers option within the JSM Project ([https://yourinstancename.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/projectkey/customers|https://yourinstancename.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/projectkey%7D/customers])
 # Add an organisation or open an existing organisation
 # Click on Add Customers
 # Add multiple email addresses
 # Go back to the Customers page ([https://yourinstancename.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/projectkey/customers|https://yourinstancename.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/projectkey%7D/customers]) 
 # Search for an email address that part of the organisation but not added individually to the project 

h3. Expected Results

_Once the customers who are part of an Organisation added, they should be searchable from the customer top level page._
h3. Actual Results

_Some of the customers are not showing in the results of the search._
h3. Workaround

_Go directly to the Organisation to see if the customer is already part of the customers in the project._
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Some organisation customers are not found when searched from top level customer page

fields.description:
h3. Problem

We see that the the automation link is placed at different places/positions in JS and JSM.

h3. Suggested Solution
Under JS, it is placed under project settings on the top and we would like to see the same position for JSM as well.


h3. Why This Is Important
This helps the customers to easily identify the Automation for Jira link and brings a consistency in the appearance of the links across different products.

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Please place 'Automation' section at the same place as JS

fields.description:
h3. Problem

We would like to have the ability to link forms fields to third party app synced fields such as fields created by Advanced Issue Linking.

Please provide field linking for third party apps.
h3. Gathering Interest

We are currently gathering interest in the applications and fields that people use in Jira so that we can prioritise which fields to support first. Please leave a comment below calling out the fields/apps you need.
fields.summary: Form Fields: Support third party app fields i.e. Advanced Issue Linking

fields.description:
h3. Problem

We would like to have the option to disable the reopen option in forms for our agents so that data can't be changed in this way and the forms remains as is once closed.
h3. Workaround

The option to lock a form on submission is designed to address this exact problem. Under form settings there is an option to *Lock on Submission* once a form is locked it can only be reopened by Project Admin or Jira Admin.
fields.summary: Disable Reopening of forms by agents

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Profile pictures that pops up is blurry when we try to perform "Share with" for a ticket on customer Portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a ticket on portal
 # Try to share the ticket with any user having profile picture

h3. Expected Results

Profile picture should be clear when it pop-ups
h3. Actual Results

Profile picture pops up are blurry while sharing the ticket.

!image-2021-12-15-16-55-53-312.png|width=468,height=419!
h3. Workaround

No workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Profile pictures that pops up is blurry when we try to perform "Share with" for a ticket on customer Portal.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to load the form builder of a large form, it will take a long time to load

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create large form, for example 
#* with 500 questions
#* and 200 sections
# Load that form's form builder

h3. Expected Results
The form builder load quickly

h3. Actual Results
The form builder takes a long time to load
The browser's profile will show the most time taken on Scripting and Rendering
!browserprofile.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Proforma is not currently supporting such a large form (with hundreds of questions and sections). It's recommended to reduce the size of questions for a single form, and utilize conditional logic and automation to add another form when a form is submitted.
fields.summary: Slowness in loading Form Builder page of a Large form

fields.description:
h3. Problem

We would like to be able to create forms under tickets based on parent issue type. E.g.,
 * if we have parent tasks (A, B, C, etc.)
 * with potential subtasks (a, b, c, et.c)
 * we would like the subtasks to have certain forms associated with them if the parent tasks are (e.g,) A and B, but *not* C.

h3. Proposed Solution

The integration of Forms with Automation will support adding forms to an issue (and subtask) as an action. This should allow the above scenario to be completed.
fields.summary: Allow form creation based on parent and subtask type

fields.description:
Currently Proforma Forms fields cannot be linked to Affected Version field.

This is something customers would like to be able to do in order to keep form fields linked to this specific field.
fields.summary: Form Field: Support Affected Version field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

ProForma forms are not available in the jira mobile app when viewing an issue with forms.
h3. Workaround

Use a mobile browser to view ProForma forms.
fields.summary: Forms (ProForma) not available in the Jira mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the email Field only allows a single email address to be entered and validated.
But we have some cases where several (1-N) email addresses could be entered.

It would be nice if users could could separate emails using ';' like Outlook for example.
fields.summary: Form Field: Allow multiple email addresses

fields.description:
There is no Calculated Field Type available in ProForma. 
In the situation of a purchase request form, it would be nice to have a Total Field or a Cost*Quantity Field.
fields.summary: Form Field Type: Calculated Field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It would be nice to have a REST API (similar to what Jira already has for its Core features) to integrate it with an external application and manage Forms.

Reproducing the following APIs form ProForma in Server/DC would be a good start:

*Form Functions*
 * Add a form to an issue
 * Submit a form
 * Reopen a form
 * Unlock a form
 * Copy a form from one issue to another
 * Change the visibility of a form
 * Attach PDF of a form to an issue

*Reporting / Export*
 * Access an array of form responses
 * Download a PDF, XLSX or JSON of form
fields.summary: REST API for ProForma/Forms in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When setting up a form, there is a user-picker field that allows for user search. Customers want to assign a default user to this field, which currently is not possible.
fields.summary: Allow for default value to be set on User Picker field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The form is not created if the creator does not have permission to access the request

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set an [Issue Security level|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-issue-security-schemes/] that says that only "admins" and "reporters" have access to that request.
# Now access the JSM portal and submit a request _on behalf_ of someone else.

h3. Expected Results
The form should be submitted without any further issues.

h3. Actual Results
The ticket is created, but the form is not attached to the request. Checking application logs we can see the following error is thrown:
{noformat}
Cannot create initial form because form for request type <ID> was not found on project <KEY>
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This might also happen on slight variations of the steps mentioned above. For example, just removing the reporter from the security level produces the same behavior.

h3. Workaround
Make sure that the user submitting the ticket has permission to see the ticket after its creation time.
fields.summary: The form is not created if the request "creator" does not have permission to access the request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We would like to have the option to disable the reopen option in forms for our agents so that data can't be changed in this way and the forms remains as is once closed.
h3. Suggested Solution

The LOCKED is designed to meet this ask. Enabling the Form Setting '{*}Lock on submission'{*} means that a only a Project Admin will be able to reopen a form.
fields.summary: Form Setting: Disable the Reopen option for agents

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update as of 15 December 2021}
Hey all,

The native forms application does not yet support Team-Managed Software projects; however, it is coming.

Cheers, 

Simon.
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The Form settings within a Team-Managed software project is blank instead of listing the existing forms.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Team-Managed software project (Kanban/Scrum)
 # Go to *Project settings* > *Apps* > *Forms*
 # Create a form
 # Go back to *Project settings* > *Apps* > *Forms*

h3. Expected Results

You will see a list of the existing forms.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing loads below the title and buttons for *Help* and {*}Create form{*}.
h3. Workaround

Create a new form, and just close it, you will be redirected to the URL that actually loads the list of existing forms. The URLs are different.
 * Defective URL: {{https://<site_name>.atlassian.net/jira/software/projects/<PKEY>/settings/apps/com.thinktilt.proforma.add-on__project-forms}}
 * Working URL: {{https://<site_name>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/com.thinktilt.proforma.add-on/project-forms?project.key=<PKEY>&project.id=<PID>}}
fields.summary: Form settings on Team-Managed software project is blank

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Upon adding customers into an organisation list, there is a delay until the customers information will be showing in the page (the delay could take up to 2 minutes). 
h3. Environment

JSM Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Customers option within the JSM Project ([https://yourinstancename.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/projectkey}/customers])
 # Add an organisation or open an existing organisation
 # Click on Add Customers
 # Add the email address of the customers
 # Refresh the page (you should see the person added disappear)

h3. Expected Results

_Once the customers added into an organisation, it should be showing immediately._
h3. Actual Results

_Customers added into an organisation, currently it doesn't show immediately and will take up to 2 minutes along with page refresh to get the customers displayed._ 
h3. Workaround

_No workaround, we just need to wait for up to 2 minutes until the next system refresh for the customers to be showing._
fields.summary: Delays in Adding Customers into an Organisation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When importing CSV/JSON files into JSM Insight and trying to import an object that is referencing a multiple cardinality Object attribute, it does not work. 

In [the documentation|[https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/import-a-csv-file-into-insight/]] mentions the following:
{noformat}
To divide multiple values (for the Insight Attributes with multiple cardinalities), you can use "||" (2 pipe characters) within the CSV file."{noformat}
 

But it does not work if the attribute references an object even though this is achievable through UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object with an attribute that retrieves another object type
 # Change the attribute cardinality to unlimited
 # Try using CSV to set multiple values on the attribute
 # Execute the import

Can use this setting:

!image-2021-12-15-10-32-09-208.png|width=700,height=251!

!image-2021-12-15-10-32-37-852.png|width=690,height=324!

*!image-2021-12-15-10-33-17-732.png|width=686,height=335!*

*sample file content:* 
!image-2021-12-15-10-31-08-823.png!
h3. Expected Results

To import multiple object references
!image-2021-12-15-10-33-47-187.png|width=444,height=205!
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't import the reference attribute (attachment) at all.

!image-2021-12-15-10-34-15-595.png|width=478,height=205!

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour.
fields.summary: JSM Insight - Import from csv/json object with multiple cardinality doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Users have complained a lot about the new issue view:
 * Comment header has the same size and style as normal comment body text
 * If comments use a lot of styles such as headers, bold/italic text, etc., it quickly becomes difficult for a user to visually distinguish where a single comment begins and ends

h3. Suggested Solution
 * First option: Change comment header size and/or style so that, on average, it is immediately visible where a new comment begins
 * Second option: Add possibilities for admins to change comment presentation to their liking, using an editor similar to the one used for editing notification templates

h3. Why This Is Important
 * Users are having a hard time visually parsing the comments section of tickets they work with, and it takes them longer than necessary to find information they are looking for
 * With the suggested change, users should be able to visually parse the comments section faster to get to the info they are looking for

h3. Workaround

No currently known workaround
fields.summary: Help users distinguish between many comments in the issue

fields.description:
An insight field added to customer portal form, containing +50 objects within the insight field, it does not show all of the objects when selecting a value through the customer portal form.

The user can search on objects, but to search the user needs to be aware of the available values as this is quite difficult.

It would be practical if all values could be shown in stead of 50.
fields.summary: Insight custom field in request form should show more than 50 objects

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to update the default "Customer Notifications" that are created for new Service Desk projects.
h2. Use case and details
 - On an existing JSM project, navigate to "{*}Project Settings > Customer notifications{*}"
 - Edit any of the notifications ({*}here an option to "Set as default for new projects"{*} would be amazing)
 - Now I want to create a new Project and automatically have the new/default notifications automatically set for this project

h2. Is a workaround available?
 - No
 - Attempted to create a new project using another company-managed service project as a template. However, this does not copy the customer notification settings over.

h2. Why?
 - This will help speed up new project creation
 - Unified notification/language across multiple products
 - Admins can spin up new projects without having to re-configure all customer notifications
fields.summary: Ability to set default Customer Notifications for new projects

 * re-opened,

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Ability to auto-populate custom field values based on the inputs of other custom fields.
h3. Suggested Solution

For instance: when a customer enters a postal code, the address, site location needs to get auto-filled in a custom field. 
h3. Why this is important

It's easier for the user as the field will automatically be populated.
fields.summary: Auto populate custom fields based on another field value in the customer portal.

fields.description:
h1. User Story

As a IT director, I need the ability to create "bi-directional" object-referencing attributes to prevent my data from being out of sync.
h1. Context

We use Insight to manage (among other things) our laptops, our users, and the relationship between the two. To visualize this, we have an object-referencing attribute on our "Laptops" object type called "Owner" linking to the "User" object type.
h1. Problem
 * When viewing the "User" objects, all we see to indicate that there's a link to another object is the "incoming reference" count, which is minimally helpful.
 * Putting an object-referencing attribute on the "User" object type linking back to a "Laptop" gives me what I would expect to see (an attribute showing the laptops owned by the user), but this is an entirely different field, so there's the possibility that each side could be out of sync with the other.

h1. Desired Behavior

When I make an object-referencing attribute in one Object Type, I have the option to add "the other side" of the reference as an attribute on the referenced Object Type.

Thus a "Owner" attribute on the "Laptop" Object Type could be tied to a corresponding attribute (which ideally I could rename as I wished, in this case to something like "Assigned Laptop(s)") which would\could only show the laptops assigned to the user.
fields.summary: Support Bidirectional Object Attributes in Insight

fields.description:
When a closed/resolved issue is cloned, the satisfaction rate of the original issue is copied over to the clone.

h3. Suggestion
Add the ability to clone issues leaving the CSAT of the clone blank.
fields.summary: Ability to clone issue without copying the satisfaction rate

fields.description:
We need to add images in the timeline and/or in the description of an incident.

In any way. Either as an attachment or inline in the text.
fields.summary: Opsgenie: Allow images to be entered in the timeline and description of incidents

fields.description: It would be great to integrate MS Teams for Incident Management the same way we have for Zoom and Slack.
fields.summary: MS Teams based Rooms and Channel for Incident Management

fields.description:
h3. Problem description

By default, in column view, Insight displays only the Key, Name, Created and Updated fields. It would be useful if administrators could change the default columns in the columns view so that users see more useful fields in the first instance. It would be good if these defaults could be configured on an Object Type. 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to set the default view for an Object Type for all users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Insight Discovery Import - multiple files may be exported from Discovery to Insight Cloud using the Discovery Import. 
Here are three scenarios: 
1. One Discovery Instance may have a few Scan Settings running one after the other.
2. A few Discovery instances may run at the same time, using the same Cloud Import Token in their Export to Cloud.
3. Several Discovery Instances are moving the scan results, to be picked up and exported by the Collector.

All three scenarios will result in:
One Scan Result file is being Exported/importing in Cloud, while another Scan Results file is attempting to export to the same Import Configuration - as it is using the exact same Token.

As the import engine is busy - it returns a 400 error, and the job is not being queued up. The failed to export files will remain in the Scans directory.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Few options to test:
- Configure 2 scan settings, each with one IP address and Export to Cloud. Make sure the 1st scan setting will return a lot of information (using many Patterns) and set the second Scan Setting to gather only basic information (Hostinfo patterns) from the Localhost running discovery. - Set export to a Cloud instance.
- Configure 2 Discovery Instances, use the same Cloud Import Token in both, and execute a scan in each, time the scans so that one scan is finishing right after the other (e.g. 1st instance to have a long range of IPs, and the other to have only one... trigger the second instance to scan when the first is almost done...)
- gather a few Scan Results files, into the Scans folder, configure Export to Cloud with a Valid token, execute Discovery.exe -z to trigger the file transport
- gather a few Scan Results files, into the Import folder, configure a Collector to  Export to Cloud with a Valid token, polling interval 1m, and install it as a service / trigger it manually.
 # Check the logs (Discovery / Collector) and revise the Schema in Insight Cloud

h3. Expected Results

All file are exported to Cloud, Scan/Import folder is empty, all the scanned info is imported and visible in Cloud.
h3. Actual Results

One file is Exported to cloud, all other files are kept in Scans, and log shows 400 response for each

fields.description:
h1. User Story

As an IT director attempting to generate reports on my ITSM work managed in Jira Service Management, I would like to be able to access data being stored about my tickets as columns, because I need to be able to generate reports using this information that Jira cannot do natively.
h1. Context
 - Jira Service Management stores _all sorts_ of useful information about issues. For example, JSM issues contain information about how they were created in the "request.channel.type" field; indeed, you can filter on this dimension in a JQL search. However this field is not available as a column in Issue Navigator, so you cannot easily export it into a file and use it for reporting.

 - Reporting in general, and historical and artifact reporting in particular, are weaknesses of JIRA. This necessitates us to export Jira data for use in other tools.
h4.
fields.summary: Allow "request.channel.type" to be a column in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to use a built-in or custom dropdown field in a series for reports, if the field's context is restricted to projects (meaning it is not Global), when you try to add the field to Filter by on a series, the field returns none of the options set on the dropdown.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create dropdown field
 # Restrict its context to project(s)
 # Try to add it as a filter on a report series

|!Screen Shot 2021-12-08 at 12.03.28.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2021-12-08 at 12.04.20.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Expected Results

The field will list all available options on the dropdown field.
h3. Actual Results

The field returns "No Matches"
h3. Workaround

Edit the field's _Contexts and default value_ and edit its context to make the field *Global*
|!Screen Shot 2021-12-08 at 12.05.41.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2021-12-08 at 12.06.29.png|thumbnail!|
fields.summary: Restricting dropdown field context to project(s) disables its options for usage on report series

fields.description:
Currently, the *Project* attribute type is present in the Insight server version.
h3. Suggested Solution

Include Insight attribute type 'Project' within Insight Cloud objects as well.
h3. Why This Is Important
 - It is a loss of functionality for the customer migrating to the Cloud with this attribute.
fields.summary: Include Insight attribute type 'Project' within Insight Cloud objects

fields.description: Customer search in the Jira Service Project should show all customers added to customer tab, even if they have: Atlassian Account, agent access, Site access, JSM license,
fields.summary: Customer search to be more

fields.description:
Currently, the automation rule updates a maximum of 50 objects for Scheduled trigger in a single run.

*Suggestion:*

Increase the update count per scheduled run.

*Workaround:*

Increase the scheduled interval for the automation rule so that it can update all the required objects in multiple runs.
fields.summary: Update more than 50 objects in a single scheduled automation run

fields.description:
When reporting a problem we run in to the limits of attaching files. The maximum is 5. and the maximum size is 2 mb. 

I get that you dont want to open up the system to gigantic attachments, however 2mb is nothing. Forcing you to split it up in more files.

Please increase the size to 20mb
fields.summary: Attachment limits are to small in Opsgenie problem reporting

fields.description:
h3. Issue

Currently, the "Approval required" customer notification template doesn't allow for reordering of the placement of the approval buttons in the message body. It will always show at the top of the message body, along with the text "This request requires your approval", as shown below:
!Approval required template.png|width=265,height=232!

This prevents JSM admins from customising the customer notification to their preference.
h3. Suggested solution

Perhaps re-introducing the {{{}$\{approval.buttons{}}}} variable to control the placement of the buttons within the message body.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Allow customisation of the approval button placement in the "Approval required" customer notification

fields.description:
The "Service Registry" feature in the IT service management template has a description field to list information about the Service. It's a plain text field, it would be great to be able to use any kind of formatting but particularly linking. 

We document our Services in Confluence, so being able to insert a link to the Confluence page about the service would be very useful.
fields.summary: ITSM Services - Allow markup or links in Service description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users that have an existing JSM Cloud subscription can see the option to change their plan. Within that screen there is a comparison chart that shows the differences between the plans. Currently the Free plans shows unlimited notifications, however there is a limit on the number of daily notifications a free plan can send, currently 100 as per [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/what-is-the-free-jira-cloud-plan/]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From a JSM Cloud site, can go into Administration > Billing > under Jira Service Management choose Change, to see the plan options

h3. Expected Results
 * Expect that Free plan limitations are clearly posted here
 * [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/what-is-the-free-jira-cloud-plan/] indicates there is a 100 notifications daily limit

h3. Actual Results
 * Free plan indicates an unlimited number of notifications
 * !jsmfreeplannotificationlimit.png|width=614,height=635!

h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: When using change plan for a JSM, the free plan indicates an unlimited number of notifications, when there exists a limit of 100

fields.description:
Ability to restrict Jira Service Management agent to assign to other agents in the common group 

Use case: When there are different levels of escalation, one group should be able to handle one level of escalation, so when one agent is on leave, the ticket can be assigned to other agents on the same level.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict Jira Service Management agent to assign to other agents in their group

fields.description:
The SLA fields by design would show either time left to breach or time since breached. However, when you hover over them you're able to see actual time elapsed since the SLA started ticking.

A user would like this 'actual time' information in the issue import.
h3. Suggested Solution

A user would like this 'actual time' information in the issue import file and also an option to set the desired format in the issue view
h4.
fields.summary: Actual Time in SLA
